summary: The federal government spends billions of dollars to operate and maintain its real property assets, which include buildings, roads, and bridges. Agencies are responsible for managing these assets efficiently and cost-effectively. We identified 6 key characteristics of effective asset management. For example, we found that leadership support—with leaders clearly articulating their support and providing resources—can help. The federal information available to help agencies maximize the...
title: Federal Real Property Asset Management: Agencies Could Benefit from Additional Information on Leading Practices
